summary:
"Be Here Now" is Oasis' third album, released in 1997. It was recorded in London and Surrey and features longer songs with lots of guitar layers, making it sound big and powerful. The album cover shows the band at Stocks House. It's the last album with original members Paul "Bonehead" Arthurs and Paul "Guigsy" McGuigan.

The album was very popular, selling fast and topping charts in many countries. However, some people criticized it later for being too long and having too much production. The band members have mixed feelings about it.
title: Be Here Now (album)
